titleStmt.title: Oliver P. Morton, Agent, R. A. Dowell
CWG1104

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Requisitions for the Return of Fugitives from Justice, 1863-1867

body.p:
Agents Appointment to Receive a Fugitive from Justice.
IN THE NAME AND BY THE AUTHORITY OF THE STATE OF INDIANA,
I Oliver P. Morton Governor of the State of Indiana.
TO ALL WHO SHALL SEE THESE PRESENTS--GREETING:

Know Ye, That reposing especial trust and confidence in the integrity, diligence, and ability of R. A. Dowell I do hereby appoint him Agent on the part of this State, to proceed to the State of Kentucky for the purpose of demanding and receiving from the proper authorities of said State, John W. Rutherford a Fugitive from Justice from the State of Indiana, charged with the crime of Perjury by Indictment in the Vanderburgh Circuit Court, Ind and I do hereby authorize and direct the said R. A. Dowell to demand and receive the said Fugitive, and bring him to this State, and deliver him to the custody of the Sheriff of the County of Vanderburgh
"The State will pay no part of the expenses of the execution of this Writ."

In Testimony Whereof, I have hereunto set my hand, and caused to be affixed the Seal of the State, at the City of Indianapolis, this Seventeenth day of May in the year of our Lord One Thousand Eight Hundred and Sixty Five, the Forty Ninth year of the State, and of the Independence of the United States the Eighty Ninth

BY THE GOVERNOR:
O. P. Morton
Nelson Trusler
SECRETARY OF STATE
